data.title: Wireframe, Normal Binormal Tangent displayer appstates
data.body:
Convenience appstates that show and keep in sync the representation of normal binormal and tangents, and the wireframe on top of existing geometries contained on the node passed as argument to the constructor.

Limitations:
- Doesn't handle shaders transformations.

Require pr #450

data.title: Added method to see if VertexBuffer is not used
data.body:
Since updateBufferData is not called for VertexBuffers that are not available in the shader, their updateNeeded state will stay set to true, while logically should be false, since those buffers won't ever be updated.

updateBufferData cannot be called on unused buffers without breaking the existing code (i.e. material switching).

This commit contains the most straightforward way i can think about for fixing this problem.

Refering to http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/see-if-a-mesh-has-been-changed/35346/6

data.title: Skybox breaks Ray Collision
data.body:
Hey,
So the history:
Back in alpha1 there was an optimation which caused Collisions between a Sphere and a Bounding Box to throw an Exception (iirc). As several threads popped up, @pspeed42 found out that this optimation actually breaks more than it helps.
I don't know if this is connected, maybe Paul remembers, but I wanted to point that out.

Now we have the Issue that once you have a skybox in the SceneGraph under the Node you collide with, you get no results at all.

See [here](http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/solved-why-does-my-mouse-picking-not-collide-with-anything/35241) and there are also more posts like that (which is why I had that idea).

I didn't include a test case but it should be easily reproducable.

data.title: fix NPE in hovering tank test, running with native bullet
data.body:
A NPE is throw when running hovering tank test with native bullet.

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: The vehicle object does not exist.
    at com.jme3.bullet.PhysicsSpace.addVehicle(Native Method)
    at com.jme3.bullet.PhysicsSpace.addRigidBody(PhysicsSpace.java:627)
    at com.jme3.bullet.PhysicsSpace.addCollisionObject(PhysicsSpace.java:426)
    at jme3test.bullet.PhysicsHoverControl.setPhysicsSpace(PhysicsHoverControl.java:189)
    at com.jme3.bullet.PhysicsSpace.add(PhysicsSpace.java:405)
    at jme3test.bullet.TestHoveringTank.buildPlayer(TestHoveringTank.java:156)
    at jme3test.bullet.TestHoveringTank.simpleInitApp(TestHoveringTank.java:128)
```

Because the native vehicle wasn't created in the setPhysicsSpace methode (in PhysicsHoverControl)

---

The collision group must be set after the creation of the native body (when setPhysicsSpace is called).

data.title: Blender Importer crashes when loading files converted from .fbx
data.body:
Well the title is not really well chosen but here's what I encountered:
I was working on the .fbx -> .blend -> .j3o SDK Shortcut and it turns out that the Blender Importer is incapable of even the most basic files.

What I did:
- Take the usual blender startup file (one box, one light (I deleted the camera)) and export it to .fbx
- Import that .fbx file in Blender and save the .blend (This was done automatically but the process should be the same)
- The file looks OK when viewed in Blender at this point
- Try to load this file and convert it to j3o -> Failure!

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.meshes.MeshHelper.loadVerticesGroups(MeshHelper.java:289)
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.meshes.TemporalMesh.<init>(TemporalMesh.java:126)
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.meshes.TemporalMesh.<init>(TemporalMesh.java:100)
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.meshes.MeshHelper.toTemporalMesh(MeshHelper.java:114)
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.BlenderLoader.load(BlenderLoader.java:128)
Caused: java.io.IOException: Unexpected importer exception occured: null
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.BlenderLoader.load(BlenderLoader.java:223)
    at com.jme3.scene.plugins.blender.BlenderLoader.load(BlenderLoader.java:88)
    at com.jme3.asset.DesktopAssetManager.loadLocatedAsset(DesktopAssetManager.java:262)
Caused: com.jme3.asset.AssetLoadException: An exception has occured while loading asset: Models/box.blend
```

Here are the models: 
[box.zip](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/files/170206/box.zip)

Oh and it could be that the .fbx importer is simply saving some things strange however that shouldn't raise any NPE :) 

Edit: Further Investigation shows:

```
Start offview panel
Camera created (W: 320, H: 320)
Loading noise constants.
Loading animations that will be later applied to scene features.
Loading ambient light.
Loading blender object.
Type of the object: MESH.
Loading obejct: Cube.001
Importing object of type: MESH
Loading temporal mesh named: Cube.001.

Loading vertices and normals from mesh: Cube.001.
Loaded 8 vertices and normals.
Loading vertices colors from mesh: Cube.001.
Loading UV coordinates from mesh: Cube.001.
Loading vertices groups from mesh: Cube.001.
Loading all faces from mesh: Cube.001
Reading BMesh.
Loaded 6 faces.
Loading all edges that do not belong to any face from mesh: Cube.001
Loaded 12 edges.
Loading all points that do not belong to any edge from mesh: Cube.001
Loaded 0 points.
Loading materials.
Loading material.
Loading model's textures.
No textures optimisation applied.
Material's name: Material.001
Reading custom properties.
Child (Cube.001) attached to this node (Cube.001)
Storing loaded feature in blender context and applying markers (those will be removed before the final result is released).
Reading and applying object's modifiers.
Converting temporal mesh into jme geometries.
Converting temporal mesh Cube.001 to jme geometries.
Cube.001 (Node): Child removed.
Preparing faces geometries.
Triangulating temporal mesh.
Triangulating face.
Triangulating face.
Triangulating face.
Triangulating face.
Triangulating face.
Triangulating face.
Appending 6 faces to mesh buffers.
Converting mesh buffers to geometries.
Applying materials to geometries.
Preparing lines geometries.
Child (Cube.0011) attached to this node (Cube.001)
Applying proper scale to the geometries.
Applying animations to the object if such are defined.
Loading constraints connected with this object.
Loading constraints.
Loading custom properties.
Cube.001: (0.0, 2.4013171, 0.0)--> null
Loading blender object.
Type of the object: LAMP.
Loading obejct: Lamp.001
Importing object of type: LAMP
Storing loaded feature in blender context and applying markers (those will be removed before the final result is released).
Reading and applying object's modifiers.
Applying animations to the object if such are defined.
Loading constraints connected with this object.
Loading constraints.
Loading custom properties.
Lamp.001: (4.0762453, 5.903862, -1.005454)--> null
Loading material.

Only image textures can be loaded as unlinked assets. Generated textures will be applied to an existing object.

```

So it's actually strange since I didn't find any object called Cube and hence no more structures are on the stack.

data.title: Missing getHeight present on jbullet
data.body: Well, I found that I'm using this on my code with jbullet but is not present on bullet version so here it is.

data.title: Fixed collision group listeners not being notified
data.body:
In native bullet, group collision listeners we're never notified when a collision occurred for a group. This fixes the issue.

See http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/physicscollisiongrouplistener-possibly-broken-in-native-bullet/35277/7

data.title: Added public method getGeometry on Batch class.
data.body:
Exposed batched geometry to the users in case they need to implement their own batching or post-batch corrections.
See: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/batching-layering/35254

data.title: Fixes #442 - Add 64bit detection for the armv7 platform
Add 64bit Detection for armv7l
data.body:
See http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/unsupported-architecture-armv7l/35267

According to http://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/136407/is-my-linux-arm-32-or-64-bit, `arm8` is the first architecture to be 64bit, so `armv7*` is always 32bit.

data.title: Extract Native Bullet's Library in Headless mode
data.body:
http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/solved-bullet-doesnt-find-native-library-when-running-game-in-headless-mode/35246/2

This pretty much explains it.
We should maybe move that code outside of the `LwjglContext`anyway, since it'd apply for JOGL, etc pp.
The question only is whether to keep the lwjgl part inside the context or move that all out into something like a NativeLoader (and use if's to load jwlg/jogl/bullet)

data.title: Rotating models in SceneComposer in SDK not done correctly
data.body:
Rotating a model in scene composer is not done correctly and Parent node box not rotating along with mesh box and cause problem in transforming model in scene.
see detailed description here : 
http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/bug-report-problem-with-rotating-models-in-scenecomposer-in-sdk/35224

data.title: Update BufferUtils.java
data.body:
Fixes #395 

Summary: fixes calling destroyDirectBuffer from multiple threads

data.title: Bone animation bind transform bug
data.body:
The constructor doesn't "Only copies the name and bind pose from the original.". It takes the object references from the original which leads to shared bind transforms.

For example several same models are loaded and each model should have different e.g. arm sizes. If all models shares the same bind object references, all models have the same arm size instead of different ones.

A simple clone() makes a real copy and fixes this problem. Now its prossible to have different sized and bone animated arms.

Hint:

enabling UserControl disable bone animations, so this is not the way I want. I want bone affected by animations and customized bone transforms (bind transforms).

Forum link: http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/bug-bone-animations-share-their-bind-transforms/35217

data.title: Fixed the Issue where removing a Control didn't set the dirty flag
data.body:
See http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/dirty-flag-not-set-when-deleting-model-controls/35216
btw: Fix Imports removed some unused imports and the "fireSave" Override is lent from JmeLight.java

data.title: LWJGL 3 context cannot be created on Mac OS X
data.body:
Mac OS X requires window management code to run on the main thread. Unfortunately, jME3 creates a separate thread to initialize the window. 
This will be a breaking change which is only included for applications opting to use LWJGL 3.

data.title: Be more verbose when the Asset Path is outside of the root.
data.body:
See [here](http://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/blender-trouble-with-multi-part-character-model-how-to-do-it-right/35121/9)
This is essential for importing models (as you then don't know which assetKey triggered the error)

data.title: Bug on first sight
Improved ShaderNodes
data.body:
- Fixed a NPE when trying to select a Node. Now you can properly remove/edit nodes
- "smartLog" now compares the hash across different instances (Two Material Previews led to duplicate log messages)
- Using smartLog for CompilationErrors now to not spam the log with 60 FPS

The Lookup failed because there was no Instance of `MatDefNavigatorPanel`.
Now everything works as intended (You can remove Nodes, change their properties, or at least select them without a crash.)

When you produce a shader compilation error, you have the same error printed three times (wireframe (geometry), solid (color) and a third). This doesn't happen anymore, since the hash is now static.

However I am uncertain because of such an example:
When you have two instances, one constantly printing a and one constantly printing b. Then smartLog wouldn't work. Since we have three Renderers with the same Material this is very unlikely.

data.title: Shader Nodes can't open Lighting.j3md
data.body:
Opening the Lighting.j3md in ShaderNodes leads to a `NullPointerException`.
The Exception itself isn't interesting, but we should find out what goes wrong so that the `ShaderGenerationInfo == null`

See https://github.com/MeFisto94/jmonkeyengine/commit/4b177caa071200b2eb5340e8c5fc20367dbe6537 for where the NPE happens.

data.title: FPS Display is Invisible When Using Swing
data.body:
When a swing canvas is used the default FPS display is missing. 

Here is a screenshot from the TestCanvas program:
![screenshot from 2016-02-27 15 26 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3982497/13375490/98b38f3a-dd66-11e5-9241-7089e43dd1d6.png)

Specifically, the background is visible but the actual FPS and statistics view is missing. I tried adding the following code to simpleInitApp() and it had no effect:

```
setDisplayFps(false);
setDisplayFps(true);
```

System information:
JDK: Oracle Java 8 (via webudp8 repository)
OS: Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS x64
Linux Kernel Version: 3.16.0-62-generic

data.title: Update Bundle.propreties to jME3.1
data.body:
Updated welcome screen to say "You are running the latest preview version of the SDK (jMonkeyEngine SDK 3.1-alpha1)" instead of SDK 3.0.
It gets data from the website like before (literally I just changed one character :smile:)

It fixes one of the bugs described in issue #329

data.title: Batch node improvements
data.body:
- Clarified in the JavaDoc that CullHint is not used for batched geometries.
- Added collideWith method that takes care of ignoring batched geometries.
- Removed some commented and not used code.
- Changed signature of isBatch method to be public final - to allow users to check the children if they are batched geometries or not.
- Corrected spelling mistake for gatherGeometries method.

data.title: Forcing the project to always build JavaDoc with UTF-8 encoding.
small bug in LightProbeFactory
sdk filters : replaced all Jme...Filter by a single JmeFilter class
data.body: I saw several classes doing exactly the same job, so why not just make one.

data.title: Two small ShaderNodes fixes
data.body:
So whilst playing around with MatDefs I found this two issues:
a) When you only have one technique, you couldn't click into the ComboBox without a crash.
The reason behind this is that you cannot select the same item itself, so closing the box will lead to selected == null.
We fix this by simply taking the first item. If there are multiple available techniques we also print a warning regarding this.

b) When you have an incomplete MatDef, we had a few NPE's which crashed the sdk and hence made switching to another MatDef impossible.
I don't know if Exceptions on a broken (and hence user edited) MatDef are intentional but since the other code checks for null's, I assume it was simply missing :) 

BTW: Example MatDef for b

```
Technique Test {
}
```
